greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of m(8) = Sum_{n>=0} 1/n!8, the 8th reciprocal multifactorial constant.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: m(k) = (1/k)*exp(1/k)*(k + Sum_{j=1..k-1} (gamma(j/k) - gamma(j/k, 1/k)) where gamma(x) is the Euler gamma function and gamma(a,x) the incomplete gamma function.
mathematica: m[k_] := (1/k) Exp[1/k] (k + Sum[k^(j/k) (Gamma[j/k] - Gamma[j/k, 1/k]), {j, 1, k - 1}]); RealDigits[m[8], 10, 103][[1]]
program: (PARI) default(realprecision, 105); (1/8)*exp(1/8)*(8 + sum(k=1,7, 8^(k/8)*(gamma(k/8) - incgam(k/8, 1/8)))) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 28 2019
(MAGMA) SetDefaultRealField(RealField(107)); (1/8)*Exp(1/8)*(8 + (&+[8^(k/8)*Gamma(k/8, 1/8): k in [1..7]])); // _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 28 2019
(Sage) numerical_approx((1/8)*exp(1/8)*(8 + sum(8^(k/8)*(gamma(k/8) - gamma_inc(k/8, 1/8)) for k in (1..7))), digits=105) # _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 28 2019
results.author: _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 05 2017
